column4: Hello all, quick question every package i try to install including wine i keep getting a error stating package operation failed. and it doesnt matter what i try to install either by the software center or apt-get i get the same error
paste the errors you get in a pastebin
sudo apt-get install somepackage
ya i get the error with that as well
we need to see that error
this is the error through the softare center http://pastebin.com/GrzHge56
run  « sudo dpkg --reconfigure -a »
ok
(Sorry i forgot to put your name first last time) with that commend i get unknown option --reconfigure
is --configure -a sorry about that
thank you
http://pastebin.com/4RHEK62R
you shoud chack what went wrong with fglrx « /var/lib/dkms/fglrx/8.723.1/build/make.log »
this is what the log says http://pastebin.com/cSQSxAJ9
you are sure you have the headers for the kernel installed?
no. this is a new install and i know nothing about ubuntu.
everything thats been installed has been done through apt-get or the software center.
maybe we should try to remove the packages that is giving problems « sudo aptitude remove fglrx-amdcccle fglrx »
install ubuntu-restricted-extras you will want that ( includes flash )
not to sound like a complete noob. but how do i do that??
with the software center for instance. search for ubuntu-restriced-extras package
or in cli « sudo aptitude install ubuntu-restriced-extras »
